channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2023110246
item.description:
Report X-2023110246

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A CALL ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE NORTH CENTER. PACKAGE WAS WET ALONG ONE SIDE. UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE/RESPONSE SHEET, THE RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023100914
item.description:
Report X-2023100914

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found on a pallet outside the HazMat Cage with noticeable signs of past leakage. It was put inside the HazMat Cage using a red tote and HazMat bag. Strangely, the driver marked it delivered from the previous day. DescribePack: The bottom was soaked while the top was stained from previous leakage. Two caps were loose. DurationRel: 14 and MitigateEffect: It was moved into the HazMat Cage using a red tote and a HazMat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023100896
item.description:
Report X-2023100896

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: WEST PALM BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered during the preload sort and was immediately removed from trailer and sent to QA for inspection and to avoid damaging any other packages. DescribePack: it seems during transit the cap loosed due to improper handing resulting in the package slowly leaking until its discovery this moring. (10/6/23) DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: immediately removed from trailer and placed in damage hazmat bin to avoid any further damages or injuries.

item.title: Report X-2023100888
item.description:
Report X-2023100888

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100888 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The cap on one of the jugs in the box was loose, causing contents to leak out. The seal under the cap did not stop the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote. 2. X-2023100890 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One of the jugs in the box was leaking contents from under the cap, even though the cap was on tight. the seal under the cap did not stop the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100839
item.description:
Report X-2023100839

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Alligare diquat herbicide 2.5 gallon was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid was secured but was still leaking. Shipping label was covering the Corrosive diamond & had no OP-900 on box. DescribePack: Bottle was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid was secured but was still leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100695
item.description:
Report X-2023100695

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Siemens Sample Probe Cleaner 2.4-liter had small dent & hole at bottom of bottle resulted to leakage & stained contents. Contents corrosive but outer box doesn't have hazmat diamond or OP-900. DescribePack: Bottle had small dent & hole at bottom of bottle resulted to leakage & stained contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100584
item.description:
Report X-2023100584

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As pkg. was going down the van line, pkg. fell off due to may pkgs. still on the belt. Pkg. was taken to QA for inspection since it was identified a Hazmat. DescribePack: Upon further inspection, it was noted that 2 of the 4, gallon containers were dented on top causing liquid to leak. Pkg. had a Styrofoam topping but no partitions inside. Damage was cause because of the pkg. falling off the belt, prior to that, contents were in good shape. Orientation arrows were present on the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed in the HWPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023100331
item.description:
Report X-2023100331

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver gave 2 different accounts of the incident to QA and P&D. Initially, driver said that it fell out of his truck, but not while he was at a delivery stop or a pickup stop and he couldn't remember where it happened. He said that someone helped him hose down the liquid when they read that the material was called "Dishmachine Detergent." The driver gave the empty drum to QA and the inside of his truck was visible with pickups on the floor of the truck at that time. There were no additional damages from that Work Area. The following day, P&D was told that the spill occurred inside the delivery truck and that "they had hosed it down", but did not say when or where the spill occurred nor did they say who helped the driver clean up the truck since the Hazmat had been the only damaged package to return to the station. Only the empty drum was brought back, no cleanup material. DescribePack: Drum is scuffed and covered in sandy dirt. The lid appears to have come open partially or partially put back on after coming off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver said someone helped him "hose it down", but not who or where or what was done with the cleanup material if any was used. Empty drum was brought back to the station.

item.title: Report X-2023100301
item.description:
Report X-2023100301

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: FORT MYERS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While being handled the orientation was changed it was noticed to be leaking. DescribePack: The lid has a safety tab which is still intact however the lid is able to twist before the seal is broken and when its orientation is any position than up the pressure of the other bottle causes the contents to squeeze through the loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kept orientation up, placed in a lined bin for processing. There is a corrosive marking on the box

DescribePack: Upon further inspection, it was noted that one of the 2, 2.5 liter container was leaking, probably dropped. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. placed in bin and stored in the HWPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023090170
item.description:
Report X-2023090170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was brought to the attention of the spill clean up specialist at our station location in Miami Florida when staining was seen indicating leaking inside the package. Package was found during the PM sort operations and was labeled as a UN 1993 Flammable Liquid n.o.s and Dry Ice. Package consisted of a fibreboard box overpack. Inside the fibreboard box was a Styrofoam box lined with a moisture barrier containing 3 jerricans of liquid commodity and 10 KG of dry ice. Inspection found the cap on one of the jerricans was loose and allowed for an estimated 1 liter of product to leak. It was instructed for liquid commodity placed in salvage drum to contain leak and dry ice to be removed. Consignee contacted for package retrieval.
